meanings.definition: To waste time in aimless or foolish activity.
meanings.sent1: Stop footling around and finish your homework.
meanings.sent2: Don't footle away your time on meaningless tasks.
meanings.sent3: The cat likes to footle with a ball of yarn.
meanings.sent4: She watched the clouds footle across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The child's mind would often footle during class.

meanings.definition: Foolish or silly talk or behavior.
meanings.sent1: His footle made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's footle entertained the audience.
meanings.sent3: Their footle about aliens was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The footle of gossip spread like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The children's footle brightened up the room.
